result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin A Apkarian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 23 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with any of the co-actors.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.  Court directs that Lincoln Hills take the sample prior to the defendan't release.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all Standard Release Conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations, returned.
Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
From Lincoln Hills.

Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Quentin A Apkarian in court, in custody (By Video Conference from Lincoln Hills), with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.
Jury Status and Jury Trial Canceled.
OTP - Canceled.

State moves to amend the felony to a misdemeanor.
Defense has no objections.
Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.


Court orders the following:
175 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
23 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co - Actors
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, Court directs that Lincoln Hills take the sample prior to the defendant's release.
 
CONDITION TIME:
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agent's discretion.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
